Pegawai KPK Jadi PNS, Menpan RB: Kan Enak Bisa Muter Kerja
04 Nov 2019, 09:16 by Pribadi Wicaksono (Kontributor), Juli Hantoro
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Pemberdayaan Aparatur Negara dan Reformasi Birokrasi Tjahjo Kumolo memastikan akan segera menindaklanjuti hasil revisi Undang-Undang Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi atau UU KPK. Khususnya, kata dia, terkait status pegawai KPK yang akan menjadi aparatur sipil negara (ASN) atau pegawai negeri sipil (PNS).
"Sekarang kami masih menerima masukan-masukan. Termasuk masukan dari pejabat KPK. Nanti kami atur dengan baik soal itu," ujar Tjahjo ditemui di Komplek Kantor Gubernur Daerah Istimewa Yogyakarta (DIY) Kepatihan Senin 4 November 2019.
Aturan mengenai KPK saat ini diatur dalam UU Nomor 19 tahun 2019. Dalam beleid tersebut, pasal 1 angka 6 UU KPK menyatakan bahwa KPK merupakan lembaga negara yang menjadi bagian dari eksekutif. Oleh sebab itu, beleid itu mengatur pegawai KPK seharusnya menjadi bagian dan tunduk pada Undang-Undang Aparatur Sipil Negara.
Klausul revisi ini menjadi satu bagian yang dinilai sejumlah pihak bakal melemahkan KPK sebagai lembaga antirasuah yang independen bekerja.
Namun, Tjahjo menilai ketentuan mem-PNS-kan pegawai KPK sudah amanat perundangan sehingga harus dilaksanakan.
“Undang-undang sudah begitu (mengatur pegawai KPK jadi PNS). Tapi kan enak, dia jadi PNS, lalu juga pegawai KPK dia bisa bekerja di kementerian yang lain, tidak hanya di satu lembaga saja tapi bisa muter di mana-mana, termasuk Kemenpan RB,” ujar Tjahjo
Ketua KPK Agus Rahardjo sebelumnya mengatakan, revisi UU KPK bakal melemahkan lembaganya. Ia menyebutkan ada sembilan poin perubahan yang bakal mempreteli fungsi KPK dalam pemberantasan korupsi.
Agus pun pertama kali menyorot bakal terganggunya independesi KPK karena revisi itu akan mengatur seluruh pegawai KPK menjadi aparatur sipil negara. Yang terdiri dari Pegawai Pemerintah dengan Perjanjian Paruh Waktu dan Pegawai Negeri Sipil.
Pegawai tetap non PNS KPK atau yang lazim dikenal pegawai internal bakal menyandang status PNS. Hal ini dinilai akan menghilangkan independensi pegawai karena kenaikan pangkat dan pengawasan akan berkoordinasi dengan kementerian terkait.

KPK Employees Become Civil Servants, Menpan RB: It Can Be Good to Work
Nov 04 2019, 09:16 by Pribadi Wicaksono (Contributor), Juli Hantoro
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Minister of State Apparatus Empowerment and Bureaucratic Reform, Tjahjo Kumolo, ensures that he will immediately follow up on the results of the revision of the Corruption Eradication Commission Law or the KPK Law. Specifically, he said, related to the status of KPK employees who would become state civil servants (ASN) or civil servants (PNS).
"Now we are still accepting input. Including input from KPK officials. We will manage it well later," Tjahjo said, met at the Governor's Office Complex in Yogyakarta on November 4, 2019.
Rules regarding the KPK are currently regulated in Law Number 19 of 2019. In this regulation, article 1 number 6 of the KPK Law states that the KPK is a state institution that is part of the executive. Therefore, the regulation regulates that KPK employees should be part of and comply with the Law on State Civil Apparatus.
This revision clause becomes a part which is considered by a number of parties to weaken the KPK as an independent working agency.
However, Tjahjo assesses that the provisions for civil servant employees of the KPK are mandated by the law so they must be implemented.
"The law is like that (regulating KPK employees to become civil servants). But it's good, he became a civil servant, then also a KPK employee, he can work in other ministries, not only in one institution but can be everywhere, including Kemenpan RB, "said Tjahjo
KPK Chairman Agus Rahardjo previously said that the revision of the KPK Law would weaken his institution. He said there were nine points of change that would strip down the KPK's function in eradicating corruption.
Agus first highlighted the disruption of KPK's independence because the revision would regulate all KPK employees to become state civil apparatuses. Which consists of Government Employees with the Part Time Agreement and Civil Servants.
Non-PNK KPK permanent employees or commonly known as internal employees will hold the status of PNS. This is considered to eliminate employee independence because promotion and supervision will coordinate with relevant ministries.
